instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Gets too hot and then gets stuck
threads.message:
Hi, I have an issue with an 820 2850 board I7 green light and orange, chime, apple logo appears or if I press alt it respond well, but after a minute the cpu is getting hot, then it gets stuck showing kind of apple logo artifacts on screen.
Where can I start?

threads.title: Gets too hot and then gets stuck
Gets too hot and then gets stuck
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 2113"]Replace C9560 with normal size 330uF.[/QUOTE]
Has to be tantalum too?Or could be this one?

[url]http://uk.rs-online.com/web/p/aluminium-capacitors/7269893/[/url]

threads.title: Gets too hot and then gets stuck
threads.message: Just rip one from a dead board as long as its 330

threads.title: Gets too hot and then gets stuck
threads.message:
Ok I replaced it from a donor board 820 3115. I put the capacitor on pin 1 and because it is bigger then I scratched a little bit on the same ground section because pin 2 is going to ground I soldered but...I have the same problem yet
Could be the capacitor bad? or maybe another thing?

Update: Cap 9560 pin 1 gives 1,3V
L9560 gives a spike of 3V then 1,3V on pin 2

Update 2: It seems that somebody has touching in the resistors r9589 area

So these are the values:
  [COLOR=#454545][FONT=Helvetica]r9589= 27,18 K instead of 51,1k[/FONT][/COLOR]
  [COLOR=#454545][FONT=Helvetica]r9585= 79,7k instead of 40,2k[/FONT][/COLOR]
  [COLOR=#454545][FONT=Helvetica]r9571= 9,23k instead of 20,5k
 [/FONT][/COLOR]
  [COLOR=#454545][FONT=Helvetica] [/FONT][/COLOR]

threads.title: Gets too hot and then gets stuck
threads.message: Could be because of that that the cpu gets hot?

threads.title: Gets too hot and then gets stuck
threads.message: Those resistors are an Apple modification. If you want you can replace the GPU+VRAM, but these boards are just trash. That is all I can say about these.

threads.title: Gets too hot and then gets stuck
threads.message:
An apple modification? Well that area it was a little bit bad soldered like somebody was playing, somebody who does not have the correct tools for that.

I know they are trash but what I think is that the pch is receiving more voltage than needed, don't tell me again they are trash I know that, please help me as much as you can.
I appreciate so much what you are doing.

Where do you think I could start I have already replaced the C9560
What could be next?

threads.title: Gets too hot and then gets stuck
threads.message:
No Title

Ok, What I see is that when the mac is cold, I have no problem it boots normally,chime, everything...but when it gets hot it gets stucked
So probably something could be sending more power than what it needs, could be something related with [FONT=Courier][SIZE=13px]GPU VCore Regulator?[/SIZE][/FONT]
Could be any buck converter that it is fucked and instead of pulses it is passing all through it? Am I saying stupids things?

I´ve been googleling and I found this:

[USER="1"]larossmann[/USER] [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER]

I have similar issue but the memory is not boiling and the gpu gets hot when I turn on the mac so...what could it be?Where can I start? Any help is more than welcome

threads.title: Gets too hot and then gets stuck
threads.message: The GPU or VRAM is probably bad. Replace that all together.
